project.teaser: Distance learning has become a great ally in the current Pandemic situation. The e-DIPLOMA project will establish the e-learning in an upper quality level in a three years’ research project, posing the use of Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality, Artificial Intelligence...
project.objective: Distance learning has become a great ally in the current Pandemic situation. The e-DIPLOMA project will establish the e-learning in an upper quality level in a three years’ research project, posing the use of Augmented Reality/Virtual Reality, Artificial Intelligence (Machine Learning/Deep Learning), Interactive Technologies, chatbots and gamification in a newly designed e-learning platform. This project will use techniques and technologies previously proven successfully in the broadcasting, gaming, and eSports industries. They will be adapted to the educational world developing innovative learning practices. A co-creation methodology will be used to include the main educational actors (teachers, educators, pupils, families, course providers and policy makers) and their social relationships. Inclusiveness, accessibility and sustainability will also be taken into account. This project states that knowing the potential, opportunities, barriers, accessibility and risks of use of emerging technologies for teaching and learning in educational practices, including necessary innovation skills for teachers, will support their digital transformation and will contribute to understanding the social, ethical, political and economic impacts of digital practices, and, in addition, it will increase the resilience of the educational world accepting the benefits of this digital change. As well, this project will consider the needs for an adequate teacher training in relation with new educational technologies, analyzing the shifting role of teachers, trainers and educational leaders in the digital transition affecting education and training as well as their training needs, including digital and leadership skills, required in an emerging society of permanent and quick technological change.
project.title: Electronic, Didactic and Innovative Platform for Learning based On Multimedia Assets
project.keywords: e-learning, co-creation, co-design, Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality, Gamification, Inmersive Technologies, Artificial Intelligence

category.title: Innovation in learning, teaching and assessment practices supported by digital technologies
category.displayCode: /Innovation in learning, teaching and assessment practices supported by digital technologies

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Report on Mapping Legal and Ethical Considerations
result.description: Scoping and analysing existing legislation and standards, stakeholder insights and knowledge, and relevant literature to identify relevant perspectives and requirements, foci, methodologies, and lessons learnt from similar systems/projects for (future) societal impact research, including: (a) review and analyses of the rights and duties of actors involved; (b) applicable legal requirements on educational software development, target groups protection, privacy and data protection, cybersecurity, etc. and the principles of transparency, accountability, discrimination, diversity; and (c) ethical and social issues that may arise with respect to the future design of the project methodology and tools within the concepts of educational technology and open access education.

result.title: Exploring Value and Ethical Dimensions of Disruptive Technologies for Learning and Teaching

details.authors: Terje Väljataga; Kai Pata; Andrea Annus; Michelle Andrade Calisto; Águeda Gomez-Cambronero; Elmar Eisemann; Athina Kasini; Ricardo Marroquim; Inmaculada Remolar; László Szécsi; Amir Zaidi; Rubén García Vidal
details.journalTitle: Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems

result.title: Ethics Plan
result.description: An Ethics Plan will be developed to ensure overall ethics compliance of the project. To achieve this, the task leader will (a) review the project goals and analyse the expected outcomes of the project with respect to the impact on social groups and individuals; (b) establish proper ethical approach and relevant procedures towards carrying outthe project activities, considering applicable research models and patterns, data classifications, KPIs, etc.; and (c) establish a methodology for researching and creating the project tools considering the notions of educational technology, open access education and inclusiveness.Additionally, a risk assessment and protocol for managing ongoing monitoring of participant well-being during the trial will be included in this deliverable.

result.title: Platform technology specification
result.description: A document analyzing the findings of WP4 from a technological point of view and specifying concrete modules along with their interfaces and interdependencies,specifying data formats to be used, and references standards and API documentation for partners involved in the WP to follow.

result.title: Balancing Innovation and Responsibility: The e-DIPLOMA Project's Approach to Ethical, Inclusive, Accessible, and Sustainable Research.

details.authors: Águeda Gómez-Cambronero; Inmaculada Remolar; Kai Pata; Elmar Eisemann; László Szécsi; Mariano Alcañiz; Tania Trayanova; Sotiris Themistocleous; Enrico Libera; Francisco Ibañez

result.title: Definition of appropriate metrics for the assessment of learning competencies
result.description: This report will specify and describe the Metrics for the evaluation of learning competencies in processes with the use of AR; and metrics to evaluate learning competencies in processes with the use of virtual reality.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The DMP will be drawn up during the first 6 months of the project and updated along the project implementation, including information on: handling of research data during and after the end of the project; what data will be collected, processed and/or generated; which methodology and standards will be applied; whether data will be shared/made open access; and how data will be curated and preserved (including after the end of the project).Also, the ethics risks related to the data processing activities of the proposal/project will be evaluated and include a data protection impact assessment conducted under article 35 General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679.

result.title: Review of e-learning ecosystems
result.description: This deliverable will incorporate the comparative analysis of e-learning systems, and sustainability and ethical considerations of practices and technologies. It will provide guidelines for the development of e-DIPLOMA practices in WP3 and will also incorporate the evaluation of teacher training responsiveness and capacity for using emerging technologies.

result.title: Report on the SWOT
result.description: A report on the SWOT analysis provided as one of the tasks of this work package will also be published. This report, which will deepen the information shown with the first one, aims to explore the social, cultural, technological, pedagogical and political barriers, the weakest points of the current e-learning platforms, the users’ opinions, the existing policies in the field and the risks related to digital education that will emerge from the SWOT analysis.

result.title: Immersive Virtual-Reality System for Aircraft Maintenance Education: A Case Study

details.authors: Águeda Gómez-Cambronero; Ignacio Miralles; Anna Tonda; Inmaculada Remolar

result.title: Project Website, Logo and Social Networks accounts
result.description: Document describing the website, the logo and the social networks accounts created.

result.title: Competency Specifications
result.description: The report will establish the different variables and competencies of human behavior that influence the effectiveness of learning in the different projects, as well as the understanding of each learning process, such as attentional or motivational processes.

result.title: Report of current policy situation and policy recommendation
result.description: Report of the current situation and Policy recommendations: Report on the level of use and knowledge of e-learning platforms and especially on their presence as an element of debate in public bodies and in the institutional context. This report will generate the recommendations that will propose several options to solve the issue by lobbying the authorities to change its normative background.

result.title: Sociocultural Contextualization Policy
result.description: Document with the developed guiding policies of all project’s outcomes and tools with sociocultural aspects

result.title: Predicting Student Performance with Virtual Resources Interaction Data

details.authors: Alex Martínez-Martínez; Raul Montoliu; Jesús Aguiló Salinas; Inmaculada Remolar
details.journalTitle: IFIP Advances in Information and Communication Technology

details.journalTitle: Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems

result.title: E-platform software
result.description: A complex package of cooperating software modules, with propertechnical documentation, installation, and user guides for both teachers and students, hardware integrationprocedures, and stock assets.

result.title: Business Strategy Baseline
result.description: The commercial exploitation strategy baseline, which will guide the business planning process, will be due at end of month 6 and be the responsibility of partner BRA and the participation of all partners. The Business Strategy will be defined using a CANVAS business model methodology.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - e-DIPLOMA (Electronic, Didactic and Innovative Platform for Learning based On Multimedia Assets)
result.teaser: The e-DIPLOMA project arises as a response to the situation caused by the COVID-19. The main objective of the project is to establish an innovative e-learning platform that enhances and consolidates distance education as a valuable and effective alternative to conventional...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
